name: 10 lvl's max AA - what would you build?
author: Templar

posts.author: Templar
posts.content:
so FRC http://frc.proboards.com/index.cgi

is back alive.

lvl 40 environment. but they only allow 10 lvl's of AA max oddly. I've been tossing a few builds around in my head but I was curious, what would you guys do if you could only take 10 lvl's of AA?

I've been looking at a wizard heavy aa myself. combined with rogue for uncanny or monk for speed. archers are unique in the AI in that if you cast a spell at someone they don't auto charge you usually but with ranged they often do.

I've been looking at a wizard heavy aa myself. combined with rogue for uncanny or monk for speed. archers are unique in the AI in that if you cast a spell at someone they don't auto charge you usually but with ranged they often do.
I'm not exactly a role model for this type of question, but I'd consider a Cleric 29 Bard 1 AA 10 Zen Archer, or a Cleric 26 Bard 4 AA 10 if you want more tumble AC and later UMD dumps. That way you can be an excellent caster and have very high AB thanks to Clerical buffs.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Hmm. I was thinking of a completely different approach, Bard 20 AA 10 RDD 10. The extra STR would let you take advantage of a mighty bow, without sacrificing any DEX to get there. In addition to the +8 STR, you also get +2 each in CON, INT, and CHA, and +4 AC, and immunity to Paralysis, Sleep (already have it as an Elf), and Fire. If you start with DEX 18 and STR 14, and take every opportunity to boost DEX, you would end with DEX 34 and STR 22. You would be an iconoclastic strong archer.

However, I like that Cleric 26 Bard 4 AA 10 idea a lot.

Oh, and another idea would be Rogue 28 Wizard 2 AA 10, with Uncanny Dodge, Epic Dodge, lots of Sneak Attack hit die, and skills galore!

Knowing me, I'll wind up building all 3 for you, just for the fun of doing it, and also to be helpful, but not until late tonight.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:You would wind up sacrificing another 2 Great DEX feats for Overwhelming Crit and Dev Crit, ending with DEX 28 and STR 26.
True, but you would make good use of these feats by insta-killing anything. With 25 BAB, +9 DEX, +4 WF/EWF/EP + 5 AA bonus, +6 Capped DEX + Bard Song and possibly Curse Song too, you would not have problems hitting. Those insta-kills could make a hell of a difference. Your AB would be lower, but your crits would be feared! Plus, you can sacrifice some other stats (such as Wisdom, for example, start with 14 CHA (since you get 2 bonus) and have all spells and everything you could ask for. I would have to try to build it to be more specific, but I don't have time now or in the foreseeable future. You do the hard work and I'll pitch in my 2 cents, deal?

Take it EZ!

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
The dev-critting archer is pretty feat starved, since he needs 6 of the 7 pre-epic feats just to qualify for AA and the overwhelming/devastating sequence. I guess it might be a tough choice to use the remaining pre-epic on curse song, called shot, blind fight, rapid shot, or even extend spell. And, there are no epic levels and thus no epic bonus feats from any of those classes in the 20/10/10 build.

Meanwhile, I am getting a final BAB of 27 (is there a reason not to take at least 8 of those 10 AA levels pre-epic?) and total unbuffed AB of 44. Not too bad, I suppose, but one can get a little jaded when working with the archer builds. The bard is an okay self-buffer, though. I suppose one could swap 4 bard levels for four epic RDD levels to get that epic bonus feat (for armor skin?) and have another general epic available for something else.

Not a terrible build on defense with some AC and RDD immunities, though I really hate having all that dex and no uncanny dodge or evasion.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
OK, so here I am with a whopping 4 builds. First is the much-discussed Bard 20 RDD 10 AA 10. There are several options to customize this build.
You could replace one of those Great DEX feats with Epic Prowess and then boost DEX at 40 instead of STR. This reduces your Dev Crit DC by 1 and increases your AB by 1.
You could replace Rapid Shot with Lingering Song, Curse Song, or Extend Spell, but that would require some shuffling of when you take what feat in the pre-epic levels.
You could put points into Listen instead of Concentration. I would choose Listen over Spot because Listen is a class skill for all 3 classes, and Spot is not.
You could take 4 more RDD and 4 fewer AA pre-epic to get Dev Crit 6 levels earlier, but you would lose 1 BAB and delay a lot of your DEX until realy late.

Empyre, I would change the Domains of the Cleric / Bard archer to Travel and Trickery, cuz noone needs to run faster than an archer, so it's vital to have Haste as an extendable resource. Also, Clerics NEVER have problems hitting things, so I would aldvise you to delay Weapon Focus to lvl 18 and take Called shot earlier. That will assure you will have an earlier way to slow your opponents down.

You're an archer, so I would lower CON to 10 and raise STR to 14 for a higher melee AB. Or, you can count on Divine Power to raise your STR, lower it to 10 (assuming no negative values is a must) and raise CON, or lower both CON and STR to 10 and get your DEX score to 16.

Other than these few tweaks, everything seems very well-organized. Good job! Too bad I don't have time to look at the rest of the builds now. I thought I'd give advice where I think I'd be more useful.

Take it EZ!

Arelith is AFAIK a low-magic world, so perma-haste is unlikely to be available

There are no extendable good spells until lvl 9 (5th spell level), after that there is Divine Power, so you can take Extend at 9 easily, because that's when you'll start buffing more often.

If you're relying on DP, then get your CON to 14 and drop STR to 10, as it will make NO difference after a while, except for carrying weight.

Called shot may not be needed at 3, but since you have Zen Archery at 6 and Extend at 9 (and you need it by lvl 9, when you'll have high enough AB to hit pretty much anything), then the only other level is 3.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Thank you for the courtesy of copying the build into your post. That was thoughtful.

The Rogue levels at 12, 17, and 22 are for well-timed skill dumps in Tumble, giving you boosts in your AC. The other Rogue levels mixed in there are, as you surmised, for more frequent boosts in your trap and lock handling skills. This will be even more important in a slow-leveling world. Also, if you went straight through to AA 10, you would have 3 fewer levels of Rogue pre-epic, and end up with the same AB.

Set Trap is 5 instead of 0 to give you a 2-point boost in Disable Trap. If you wanted to actually set traps, you would have to sacrifice some other skill to maximize Set Trap.

You figured right about Lore. That's my favorite place to put left-over points.

If UMD will be only used for Cleric scrolls and Monk items, and your world is low-magic, then you can move 10 points from UMD to Lore or Appraise.

In case you were wondering, that second level of Wizard is there for a skill dump in Spellcraft, giving you a big boost in your saves against spells.

After building this, I have found out that Crippling Strike only works with melee attacks, so you should take something else instead, like Opportunist (+4 to attacks of opportunity against an opponent), Slippery Mind (a second chance on a failed Will save), or Improved Sneak Attack.
